content.description: Bouldery start, High first bolt.  If you peel off before completing the crux doing this top rope be ready for a good pendulum. Crux is pulling the overhang.
content.protection: Bolted route and has fixed anchors at the top.
content.location: Start about 15 feet to the left of Boy Scout under a small overhang. Lower or rappel.

content.description: Left leaning crack. Crux is pulling around the bulge. Be careful of rope drag.
content.location: Look for old graffiti paint at the top of the crag.  Follow the left leaning crack up and around the bulge.

content.description:
Begin just inside the beginning of the cave on the inside corner of the left facing wall.  Follow the obvious crack all the way up.

Very nice lie back route.
content.protection: Will take both active and passive pro. From finger to hand size. Does has fixed anchors at the top.
content.location: The first route you come to at the base of the crag.   You can rappel or walk off to the right.

content.description: Look for a fallen tree that has been cut off.  To the immediate right is a small blade like arete.  Climb this blade then step left under a small over hang.  Continue up over the overhang, then up to another.  Work your way left around this overhang.  Then head straight up towards the obvious tree root at the top.
content.location: Just to the right of Big Easy

content.description: Work your way up a series of small ledges to a right leaning crack.  Follow this crack until it runs out, step left, then straight up for the finish.
content.location: Begin 10 feet to the left of Big Easy.

content.description: Boulder crux start left up the ramp, followed by a traverse left to the crack and up to a tree anchor. Unprotected crux, no gear for first half of climb. Don't fall!
content.location: Left of bolted route called Lightning.

content.description: This route takes a lot of run off when it rains and gets dirty very quickly.
content.location: Around the arete to the left of Graffiti crack.  Look for a tree that has a red trail marker attached to it.  The route starts in the corner behind this tree. Rappel or walk off.

content.description: Climb straight up then around the overhang to the left.  Work your way into the chimney up to a small ledge.  Continue up to the roof.  Traverse left under the roof then up for the finish
content.protection: Takes both active and passive pro. Sling the tree high if you are setting up a top rope to reduce rope drag.
content.location: Directly behind the now two fallen trees.
